cyclone.name: FIONA
cyclone.current_location: about 135 mi (215 km) east of Guadeloupe
cyclone.trajectory: moving west with slowing forward speed, forecast to turn WNW to NW this weekend and pass near or just south of the U.S. Virgin Islands and Puerto Rico before heading toward the southern coast of the Dominican Republic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or along the southern/west-southwestern coast of Puerto Rico

weather_observation.watch_coast: British Virgin Islands and Dominica (watch only, not Puerto Rico)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Puerto Rico (including Vieques and Culebra), U.S. Virgin Islands, Antigua, Barbuda, St. Kitts, Nevis, Montserrat, Anguilla, Saba and St. Eustatius, St. Maarten, Guadeloupe, St. Barthelemy, St. Martin
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Leeward Islands, U.S. and British Virgin Islands, Puerto Rico, eastern Dominican Republic, Turks & Caicos
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (sustained 39–50 mph with higher gusts) likely late Saturday through Sunday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Localized coastal flooding of 1–3 ft possible on north and east-facing shores, especially at high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rainfall 4–8 inches with isolated amounts up to 12 inches, producing flash-flood and mudslide risk
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents affecting exposed coastlines ahead of and during the storm
